725123f-a.title: Queens: 21st Street - 24th Drive
725123f-a.text:
21st Street, east side, at 24th Drive (vantage point).
The view is southeastward across the lot bounded by 21st and
23rd Streets and 24th Drive and 25th Avenue. In the center
background are the rears of homes fronting on the west side
of 24th Street. :he lone 2-story house facing the observer
is on the east side of 23rd Street. Local youngsters use
this place as a ball field.
P. L. Sperr  March 11, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS

725138f-a.title: Queens: 24th Drive - 21st Street
725138f-a.text:
24th Drive, west from 21st Street. The shack in
the foreground is a renting office for newly erected
dwellings.
P. L. Sperr  March 11, 1931
NO REPRODUCTIONS

726912f-a.title: Queens: Hoyt Avenue - 21st Street
726912f-a.text:
Hoyt Avenue, west from 23rd Street and across 21st Street,
toward the East River. On the right is Astoria Park. In the
background is Manhattan.
P. L. Sperr  July 25, 1936
NO REPRODUCTIONS

725118f-a.title: Queens: 21st Street - Hoyt Avenue
725118f-a.text:
21st Street, east side, between Hoyt Avenue and 25th
Road, showing two old homes. 21st Street, here, was for-
merly known as Van Alst Avenue.
P. L. Sperr  June 12, 1935
NO REPRODUCTIONS

725119f-a.title: Queens: 21st Street - Hoyt Avenue
725119f-a.text:
21st Street, at the N.W. corner of Hoyt (25th) Avenue.
The buildings are being demolished for the construction of
the Grand Central Parkway approach to the Triborough Bridge.
P. L. Sperr  May 27, 1934
NO REPRODUCTIONS
